reviewText: Biology Battle; originally released for XBIG in 2008, makes it's debut on Steam.\n\nAs a huge fan of twin stick gaming, I hold high standards when it comes to this genre game, and Biology Battle didn't disappoint me. Ported nicely, the tight controls and varity of weapons, upgrades, and power ups make this twin stick shooter an enjoyable arcade like experience, where you'll be playing just one more time" just to "one-up" your friends
date: or yourself.\n\nSure there are a lot of twin stick games that are "musts" over this one but if you are looking for something new
recommended: or an enthusiest of twin stick gaming
hoursPlayed: or just need some cheap arcade action

reviewText:
You are a medical nanobot, stuck in a biological cell, destroying .... I don't know... bacteria ?
As you can see, I'm not great at biology and I'm not great at twin-stick shooters, either.

Even though I'm not a huge fan of the genre, I think Biology Battle is pretty enjoyable. It does not do anything out of the ordinary, though; Shoot enemies, get powerups, unlock skills and don't get yourself killed. The controls are a bit wonky sometimes and a controller is highly recommended.

Fans of twin-stick shooters, will probably have fun playing this game but there are a few reasons why you might not want to get Biology Battle.
For instance, I could imagine you want to compare your scores to others. Too bad, the leaderboards are only local. Even though, there is a global leaderboard, I do not think it works (unless I'm the only one on the planet, playing this game). There are also no achievements, which is not a big deal for everyone but it certainly does not help for replay value.

However, the worst part in this game would be the false advertisement play online against thousands of real opponents". Perhaps
date: I just did not know how but whenever I tried to play online it simply did not connect me to anyone else (if this feature DOES work
recommended: I will correct this here). Besides
hoursPlayed: I do not think thousands of people are actually playing this game.\n\nSo yeah
voteText: Overall 'Biology Battle' is not a bad game but you probably will get bored with it soon unless you are a real hardcore twin-stick shooter."

reviewText:
Remember an old old game called Asteroids ? Well its exactly like that, you enclosed in small space, bunch of stuff coming towards you, and you must shoot them before they touch you. Simple as that. Gameplay doesnt offer something impressive - pick up upgrades (there are quite big variety of those) and blast everything that moves, but it provides with quite alot of fun. Game also has a tiny story that really makes you smile, atleast the first time playing.

BIology Battle was imported from xbox and that was done by a very lazy person, so seeing press Y to do smth" is quite annoying but doesnt impact gameplay.

Summary - fun and simple
date: if its on sale def worth picking up."

reviewText: While it definitely shows its XBLA roots, this dual-stick shooter is a worthy entry to the genre.  It's not even close to the fine polish you'll find in Geometry Wars 3, but it provides it's own depth and it's definitely a fun game with its own achievements to attempt.  For the price, I got it at (just over $1), it was definitely worth the money; especially if you love dual-stick shooters.  It's probably a bit much to ask the full $5 price for it though.  For the value I got, I would give it a 4 / 5.  From a pure gameplay quality / polish level and considering it's a pure indie title, I would give it a 3 / 5.

reviewText: I had purchased this game years ago and lost access when GameStop purchased the old game manager. In any event, I love the game for the visualizations, the lack of mismatched music, and the difficulty level. This is one of those games that you cannot beat. You just shoot and keep progressing until the 'monsters' get to exceeding building fire regulations for too much in too small a space. The 'monsters' also show a great variety in their attributes and forms which is fun. The multiplayer format of the game is also part of why I had originally purchased this game. If you have a couple of minutes to blow on a game to unwind, then this game fits the bill. If you want to get a friend to help you get further, then by all means. I should mention that this game works best if you use a controller (similar to Xbox 360 controlers), however you can change the controls such that you can play using a keyboard and mouse, but it is far from ideal. Oh, a kinda fun yet distracting part is the random text that shows up when you collect boosters, weapon upgrades, shields, die, or kill things.

reviewText:
I really want to recommend this game, but there are several flaws which make it nearly unplayable...


On initial launch, you're forced into 800x600 ( instead of opening a window asking for resolution; it launches the game in this resolution and in full-screen ).

The menu text is almost entirely illegible... Even when set to proper resolution.

The thin red aiming laser it hard to see in most cases and it is easy to get lost; being unable to aim or easily find yourself is one way to quickly end the game any annoy players.

All of the menu / buttons are output as though a controller must be used, and the help / tutorial windows disappear too quickly to read what they say in most cases.

$5 is too much for such a simple game. The visual effects are nice, but there is no substance other than a restricted asteroids game with different enemies.
